head.title: Metro Business; Another Bank for Stamford

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; Another Bank for Stamford

abstract.p: Dutch merchant bank Mees Pierson Holdings is relocating its corporate headquarters and 60 jobs from Manhattan to Stamford, Conn (S)

block.p: A Dutch merchant bank, Mees Pierson Holdings, is relocating its corporate headquarters and 60 jobs from Manhattan to Stamford, Conn.

The move is part of a trend of multinational financial institutions moving to Fairfield County, Conn. The Swiss Bank Corporation opened a new office complex near the Stamford train station last year, and Credit Instalt, an Austrian bank, also moved from Manhattan to Greenwich last year.
A Dutch merchant bank, Mees Pierson Holdings, is relocating its corporate headquarters and 60 jobs from Manhattan to Stamford, Conn.

The move is part of a trend of multinational financial institutions moving to Fairfield County, Conn. The Swiss Bank Corporation opened a new office complex near the Stamford train station last year, and Credit Instalt, an Austrian bank, also moved from Manhattan to Greenwich last year.

MeesPierson Holdings, a subsidiary of Fortis A.G., an insurance company, will occupy 23,000 square feet on the ninth floor of 3 Stamford Plaza. The 10-year lease was negotiated by Newmark and Company Real Estate.
The bank will leave its Manhattan offices at 445 Park Avenue, between 56th and 57th Streets, in April.
